## Fundamentals

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

Creating a vector variable

```{r}

enfermedad <- c("ira", "eda", "eruptivas")
frecuencia <- c(219,125,78)

```

Now, we have two vectors with data representing two excel columns. We can join both to create a dataframe, like a table.

```{r}

mi_table <- data.frame(enfermedad, frecuencia)

```


Perfect! Now we can plot this data. Let's do it


```{r}

barplot(frecuencia)

```

The problem in our plot is that we are missing some important info like what means each variable, let's add it to the plot.


```{r}


barplot(height = mi_table$frecuencia,
        names.arg = mi_table$enfermedad)

```

We can improve more this plot.

```{r}

barplot(height = mi_table$frecuencia,
        names.arg = mi_table$enfermedad,
        main = "Enfermedades en niños menores de 5 años",
        xlab = "Enfermedad",
        ylab = "Frecuencia")

```
